head.supplied: Town Clerk's Office ¶ Town Hall ¶ Melbourne Oct 12th 1864 ¶ My dear Dr Mueller, ¶ ¶ The Health Committee of the City Council will on Monday recommend to the Council that a contract to be entered into...

div.p: No. 363/2, 10/64, unit 10, p. 485, VPRS 4025/P Town Clerk's letter press copy books, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The Health Committee of the City Council will on Monday recommend to the Council that a contract to be entered into for the removal of the fence in Yarra Park from where you desire to erect fencing and to reerect it where it will be [servicable] in securing the outer boundaries of the Park. The report when adopted will be acted upon as quickly as possible.

With respect to Mr Hodgkinson's letter
C. Hodgkinson to M, 10 October 1864 (in this edition as 64-10-10a). and the tracing which you were so good as to enclose to me, and which I return enclosed with thanks
Tracing not found. it appears to me that a [mistaken] [impression] has been conveyed to his mind to the effect that the City Council has been contending with you in respect to the boundaries of the Botanical reserve,
See M to E. FitzGibbon, 10 October 1864 (in this edition as 64-10-10c).
which is not the case, what has been asked on behalf of the Council is that so long as the reserve be left without that security to the public which is given in respect to the residue of the park, its limits whatever they are should not be exceeded in the erection of the enclosing fences.
